title: Apply the Integral of a Sum Property
text: /int{[f(x)+g(x)],a,b,x}=/int{f(x),a,b,x}+/int{g(x),a,b,x}. In other words, the integral of a sum is the sum of the integrals. This means separating the terms into two different integrals.

title: Apply the Integral of the Product Property
text: $$\int_{a}^{b} c f{\left(x\right)} \,dx=c*\int_{a}^{b} f(x) \,dx$$ for constant c. In other words, the integral of the produce of a constant and a function is equal to the constant multiplied by the integral of the function. This means taking the constant outside and putting it in front of the integral.

title: Evaluate the Integrals and Add Them Up Together
text: Now that we applied the properties of definite integrals to the problem to manipulate the expressions, we can evaluate them to find the answer.

title: Evaluate the Integrals and Add Them Up Together
Evaluate the Integrals and Add Them Up Together
